org.liris.smartgov.lez.core.copert.tableParser

Class CopertTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.liris.smartgov.lez.core.copert.tableParser.CopertTree

  • public class CopertTree
extends java.lang.Object
    Recursive data structure designed to navigate easily in Copert parameters.
    Author:
    pbreugnot

    • Method Detail

      • getLevel

        public java.lang.String getLevel()
        Representation of the CopertTree level. Correspond to the first sub-table column name.
        Returns:
        tree level

      • getCategory

        public java.lang.String getCategory()

      • getPath

        public CopertSelector getPath()

      • select

        public CopertTree select()
        If there is only one CopertTree child from there, returns this child. If multiple children are present, select a random child. Return null if there is no more available child.
        Returns:
        a random child available from this node.

      • selectAll

        public java.util.Collection<CopertTree> selectAll()
        Returns:
        a Collection of all the available children

      • select

        public CopertTree select(java.lang.String matcher)
        Tries to find a child that match the given regular expression. If exactly one child matches, returns this child. If multiple children match, select a random child among them. Return null if no child matches.
        Parameters:
        matcher - regular expression selector
        Returns:
        A matching child

      • selectAllRegExp

        public java.util.Collection<CopertTree> selectAllRegExp(java.lang.String regExp)
        Returns all the children associated to a key that match the given regular expression. Can be used to aggregate parameters on sub-categories(e.g. : Articulated Heavy Trucks).
        Parameters:
        regExp - regular expression selector
        Returns:
        matching children

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.String value,
                CopertTree childValue)

        public SubTable getSubTable()

      • getChildren

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,CopertTree> getChildren()

      • isSingleLine

        public boolean isSingleLine()
        Returns:
        True if and only if the associated SubTable contains exactly one line.

      • lineCount

        public int lineCount()
        Returns:
        Line count of the current subtable
